intro: Brayopsis colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian brayopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a rounded inflorescence. Brayopsis colombiana is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential for medicinal use.
